values.fieldLabel: Link to repository or project page

parameters.text:
=Project name:
{{ $json['project name'] }}

Project repository or website:
{{ $json['Link to repository or project page'] }}

Docker Compose file:
{{ $json['compose file'] }}

Docker .env file:
{{ $json['env file'] }}

Additional notes:
{{ $json['notes'] }}

Instructions:
- Generate a README.md using the repositoryâ€™s standard web UI service template
- Infer purpose, configuration, and limitations from the Compose file
- Decide whether a .env file is justified and explain briefly
- Include upstream project links if the project is well-known
- Keep the README concise and consistent with other projects

README.md TEMPLATE:

# <Project Name>

<One-sentence description>



## Purpose

<Why this exists in this repository>



## What This Stack Includes

- <bullets inferred from compose>



### Configuration Overview

<Inline vs .env decision + rationale>

<Reverse proxy one-liner if web UI>



## Usage

<docker compose up -d>
<access instructions>



## Docker Socket Notes (only if applicable)

<standard warning>



## Operational Notes

<practical, experience-based notes>



### Known Limitations

<honest limitations>



## Upstream Project

- Website: <if known or inferred>
- GitHub: <if known or inferred>



## Final Notes

<short, opinionated close>

messageValues.message:
=You are generating README.md files for a public GitHub repository of Docker Compose stacks.

Tone requirements:
- Clear, concise, opinionated
- No marketing language
- No emojis
- No hand-holding
- Assume technical but sane readers

Style rules:
- Use short paragraphs and bullet points
- Avoid filler phrases
- Do not over-explain Docker basics
- Use consistent wording across projects

Security rules:
- Never invent secrets
- Never assume production deployment
- Prefer inline configuration unless secrets are present
- Only recommend .env when sensitive values exist

Network rules:
- If a web UI is exposed, include this exact sentence:
  "The web UI is intended to be accessed via a reverse proxy; the service itself is expected to remain within a trusted network boundary."

Docker socket rules:
- If /var/run/docker.sock is mounted, include a Docker Socket Notes section with a warning about elevated access.

Output rules:
- Output Markdown only
- Do not include code fences around the entire document
- Do not reference the prompt or instructions

parameters.content:
## Github Compose Readme Generator

1. Specify a valid credential for Google Gemini or the LLM of your choice
2. Set an output destination for the generated README.md file output
3. Navigate to the workflow's form URL, and you're ready to go!

--

Generated markdown files will be named <project>_<timestamp>-README.md
